prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: A new lawyer at my agency. She studied psychology while she was in Europe.
Character 1
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: An ardent young lawyer in my agency. His special feature is his very loud voice.
Character 2
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: My daughter, who also happens to be an aspiring magician. I adopted her eight years ago.
Character 3
Name: Sasha Buckler
Description: An orca trainer and performer in the Swashbuckler Spectacular. She appears to be best friends with Orla.
Character 4
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective assigned to this case. He sure makes a lot of noise, but he appears to be on the side of justice.
Character 5
Name: Ora Shipley
Description: The orca accused of murder. Though "Ora" is her real name, people like to call her "Orla". She likes to wear hats.
Character 6
Name: Jack Shipley
Description: The owner of Shipshape Aquarium. He was found dead in the orca pool.
Character 7
Name: Norma DePlume
Description: An aquarium visitor. She seems to know something about what happened.
Character 8
Name: Marlon Rimes
Description: Shipshape Aquarium's new animal keeper. He loves animals as much as he loves rapping.
Character 9
Name: Rifle
Description: A penguin that always shoots straight at her mark. She seems to love the smell of fish.
Character 10
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: A spirit medium in training. Her psychic powers are beyond question.
Character 11
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He has mastered the use of psychological manipulation in courtroom battles.
Character 12
Name: Herman Crab
Description: Shipshape Aquarium's resident vet. A baby penguin lives in his hair.
Character 13
Name: Azura Summers
Description: The trainer who preceded Sasha. She died during a show on July 20th last year.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Swashbuckler Flyer
Description: An advertisement showing an orca dressed up like a pirate. It was dropped by a penguin. An advertisement for a new show. It was dropped by a penguin. An advertisement for a new show. It appears that Sasha was not slated to return.
Evidence 2
Name: Photo of the Body
Description: A crime scene photo taken in the orca pool room. It's hard to make out details of the body. Crime scene photos taken in the orca pool room. (2 photos.)
Evidence 3
Name: Orca Pool Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the 1st- and 2nd-floor sections of the orca pool. The pool is about 65 feet deep. A cross-section view of the 1st- and 2nd-floor sections of the orca pool. Pearls apparently entered the staff corridor. It also has information about the area around the orca pool on the first and second floor. The pool is about 65 feet deep.
Evidence 4
Name: Whistle
Description: A whistle for issuing instructions to Orla. Anyone can use one to command her, as long as they know the right signals. Orla performs one trick per signal. She can't do two at a time.
Evidence 5
Name: Security Footage
Description: Video showing the orca pool from the visitor's corridor. The footage starts at the aquarium's 10 AM opening time. Video showing the orca pool. The footage starts at the aquarium's 10 AM opening time. (2 pages.)
Evidence 6
Name: Fish
Description: A large quantity of fish for feeding Rifle the penguin. Not surprisingly, it has a horribly fishy smell!
Evidence 7
Name: Walkie-Talkie
Description: Issued to all aquarium staff for communication. It can apparently also be used to broadcast inside the aquarium.
Evidence 8
Name: Calendar
Description: A penguin-shaped calendar that Pearls bought at the aquarium. It smells fishy for some reason. Apparently belongs to Rimes. It was accidently [sic] switched with Pearls's calendar around 10:10 AM. Apparently belongs to Sasha. A meeting with the victim was scheduled for 7 AM on the 20th. It turns out this doesn't belong to Sasha. A meeting with the victim was scheduled for 7 AM on the 20th. A calendar that Azura Summers gave to Dr. Crab. A meeting with the victim was scheduled for 7 AM on the 20th.
Evidence 9
Name: Bloodstained Coin
Description: A single coin seems to have fallen by the side of the orca pool. Discovered by the side of the orca pool. There are 300 coins in all, weighing 7 pounds total. This makes it a likely murder weapon.
Evidence 10
Name: Swashbuckler Video
Description: A TV recording of a performance featuring Orla, Sasha and Jack Shipley as pirates. The show song on the video is different from the one DePlume heard.
Evidence 11
Name: TV Phone
Description: A cell phone used by Shipshape Aquarium staff. This model can connect to TVs and be used to conduct teleconferencing. Summers's boyfriend has videos of her using a whistle to make the orca do tricks. A cell phone used by Shipshape Aquarium staff. Videos of Summers can be viewed. (2 pages.)
Evidence 12
Name: Shipley's Data
Description: Instant death from a brain contusion. There are signs of blunt force trauma all over the body. [info] Cause of Death: Contusion from head trauma. Bruised all over body. Death thought to be result of orca attack. Estimated Time of Death: Under Investigation. Instant death from a brain contusion. There are signs of blunt force trauma all over the body. Details updated. [info] Est. Time of Death: From 12:00 to 10:00 AM on July 20th. Cause of Death: Contusion from head trauma. Thought to be from 65-ft fall into pool. Bruised all over. Ceiling to pool bottom is 100 ft. Blow to head received after death. Shipley's walkie-talkie hasn't been found. (3 pages.)
Evidence 13
Name: "The Killer Killer Whale"
Description: A nonfiction book by Norma DePlume. It's about the case from last year.
Evidence 14
Name: Security Card
Description: A key card for gaining access to the orca pool. Only the victim and Sasha had one.
Evidence 15
Name: Prescription Bag
Description: Seized from Sasha's residence. She apparently had this filled at the Hickfield Clinic.
Evidence 16
Name: Skull Rock
Description: There's a bloodstain on the rock. The victim may have struck it when he fell to his death. A new show prop that was at the orca pool. The victim struck it when he fell. Moved from the show pool during cleaning time. The victim struck it when he fell to his death. The victim slammed into it when he fell. Orla also rammed into it. It had been moved from the show pool.
Evidence 17
Name: Pool Bottom Photo
Description: A photo of the bottom of the pool. The locations of the bloodstains detected with luminol are sketched in. [caption] The pool is partitioned into two sections by a tall glass.
Evidence 18
Name: Mysterious Capsule → "3 Zs" Sleeping Pill
Description: The strange capsule that was found in Orla's stomach. "3 Zs" is printed on it. The strange capsule that was found in Orla's stomach. It's a sleeping pill, not some kind of poison.
Evidence 19
Name: Handmade Sign
Description: A sign Sasha made for the new show. It's been left to dry since the early hours of the 20th.
Evidence 20
Name: Ladder Prints
Description: The fingerprints discovered by Pearls at the show stage. They're Rimes's, but there's something odd about them.
Evidence 21
Name: Charm
Description: Discovered in Rifle's stomach. It might belong to Azura Summers's boyfriend.
Evidence 22
Name: TORPEDO Data
Description: TORPEDO data shows that Rifle ate around 4:00 AM on July 20th, but that Orla didn't eat anything.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: In the early morning hours of July 20th, Sasha was cleaning the orca pool room.
Person: Crab
Testimony 1
Testimony: Sasha and Jack Shipley, the owner, were scheduled to do the cleaning together.
Person: Crab
Testimony 2
Testimony: The record of card usage shows that Sasha entered the orca pool room.
Person: Crab
Testimony 3
Testimony: During cleaning, the pool water is drained.
Person: Crab
Testimony 4
Testimony: While the cleaning was going on, Marlon was taking care of the orca in the show pool.
Person: Crab
Testimony 5
Testimony: The pool water would never be drained unless the pool was being cleaned.
Person: Crab
Testimony 6
Testimony: If there were no water in the pool, the orca might die.
Person: Crab

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem. I've been given a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I need to find a pair where an evidence and a testimony contradict each other. The goal is to identify just one such pair, and then present the answer in the specified JSON format.

First, I'll start by going through the list of characters to understand who is involved in the case. The main characters include Athena Cykes, Apollo Justice, Trucy Wright, Sasha Buckler, Bobby Fulbright, Ora Shipley, Jack Shipley, Norma DePlume, Marlon Rimes, Rifle, Pearl Fey, Simon Blackquill, Herman Crab, and Azura Summers. Each has a specific role and description that might be relevant to the case.

Next, I'll look at the evidences provided. There are 23 pieces of evidence, each with a name and description. Some of these seem crucial, like the Orca Pool Diagram, Security Footage, Shipley's Autopsy Report, and the Mysterious Capsule. These could be key to understanding the crime scene and the events leading up to Jack Shipley's death.

Now, moving on to the testimonies. There are seven testimonies from Herman Crab, detailing the activities in the early morning of July 20th. He mentions that Sasha was cleaning the orca pool room with Jack Shipley, that the pool water was drained during cleaning, and that Marlon was taking care of the orca in the show pool.

I need to find a contradiction between one evidence and one testimony. Let's go through each evidence and see if it contradicts any testimony.

1. **Evidence 0: Attorney's Badge** - This is just a badge, not directly related to the crime scene, so probably not relevant.

2. **Evidence 1: Swashbuckler Flyer** - An advertisement for a show, not directly related to the murder.

3. **Evidence 2: Photo of the Body** - Crime scene photos. If the photos show something inconsistent with the testimonies, it could be a contradiction.

4. **Evidence 3: Orca Pool Diagram** - Describes the pool layout. If this contradicts testimony about where the cleaning occurred or how the pool was set up, that's a point.

5. **Evidence 4: Whistle** - For commanding Orla. Not directly contradictory unless testimony mentions its use.

6. **Evidence 5: Security Footage** - Video from the visitor's corridor. If it shows something different from what Crab testified, that's a contradiction.

7. **Evidence 6: Fish** - For feeding Rifle. Not directly related.

8. **Evidence 7: Walkie-Talkie** - Communication device. If testimony mentions using it, but evidence says it wasn't found, that could be a point.

9. **Evidence 8: Calendar** - Schedules and meetings. If the calendar shows something different from what was testified, that's a contradiction.

10. **Evidence 9: Bloodstained Coin** - Murder weapon possibility. If testimony says the orca did it, but evidence points to a coin, that's a contradiction.

11. **Evidence 10: Swashbuckler Video** - Show performance. If the song heard by DePlume is different, that's a contradiction.

12. **Evidence 12: Shipley's Data** - Autopsy report. If it says death was from a fall, but testimony says it was the orca, that's a contradiction.

13. **Evidence 13: "The Killer Killer Whale"** - Book about last year's case. Not directly relevant.

14. **Evidence 14: Security Card** - Access to the orca pool. If testimony says only Sasha and Jack had access, but evidence shows others, that's a contradiction.

15. **Evidence 15: Prescription Bag** - From Sasha's residence. Not directly related.

16. **Evidence 16: Skull Rock** - Bloodstain from the victim. If testimony says the orca did it, but evidence points to a rock, that's a contradiction.

17. **Evidence 17: Pool Bottom Photo** - Bloodstains with luminol. If the photo shows something inconsistent with testimony, that's a point.

18. **Evidence 18: Mysterious Capsule** - Sleeping pill in Orla's stomach. If testimony says Orla was active, but she was drugged, that's a contradiction.

19. **Evidence 19: Handmade Sign** - For the new show. Not directly related.

20. **Evidence 20: Ladder Prints** - Rimes's fingerprints. If testimony says he wasn't involved, but evidence shows he was, that's a contradiction.

21. **Evidence 21: Charm** - From Rifle's stomach. Not directly related.

22. **Evidence 22: TORPEDO Data** - Eating habits of Rifle and Orla. Not directly related.

Now, looking at the testimonies:

- Testimony 0: Sasha was cleaning the orca pool room.
- Testimony 1: Sasha and Jack were scheduled to clean together.
- Testimony 2: Record shows Sasha entered the orca pool room.
- Testimony 3: Pool water is drained during cleaning.
- Testimony 4: Marlon was taking care of Orla in the show pool.
- Testimony 5: Pool water wouldn't be drained unless cleaning.
- Testimony 6: If pool was drained, orca might die.

Looking for contradictions:

- **Evidence 12: Shipley's Data** mentions that the estimated time of death is from 12:00 to 10:00 AM on July 20th, and that the death was thought to be from a 65-ft fall into the pool. However, according to the testimonies, the pool water was drained during cleaning, which would mean the pool was empty, making a fall into the pool impossible. This is a contradiction because the autopsy report suggests a fall into water, but the testimony states the pool was drained.

- **Evidence 16: Skull Rock** mentions that the victim may have struck it when he fell, but if the pool was drained, there wouldn't be water to cause such a fall.

- **Evidence 5: Security Footage** might show something inconsistent with the testimony about the pool being drained.

But the most direct contradiction seems to be between **Evidence 12: Shipley's Data** and **Testimony 5: Pool water wouldn't be drained unless cleaning**. If the pool was drained, then there was no water for Shipley to fall into, contradicting the autopsy report that suggests death from a fall into water.

Another point is **Evidence 18: Mysterious Capsule** which indicates Orla was drugged, contradicting the testimony that Orla was active and aggressive.

However, the most straightforward contradiction is between **Evidence 12** and **Testimony 5**, as the autopsy report suggests a fall into water, but the testimony states the pool was drained during cleaning, making such a fall impossible.

Wait, but looking back, the autopsy report says the estimated time of death is from 12:00 to 10:00 AM, which overlaps with the cleaning time mentioned in the testimonies. If the pool was drained during cleaning, then the fall couldn't have happened as per the autopsy report. This is a clear contradiction.

Alternatively, **Evidence 18: Mysterious Capsule** suggests Orla was drugged, which contradicts the testimony that Orla was aggressive and involved in the murder.

But considering the direct contradiction about the pool being drained versus the fall into water, **Evidence 12** and **Testimony 5** are the best candidates.
</think>

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other here. So, I'm looking at the provided characters, evidences, and testimonies. 

First, I'll go through the testimonies. Testimony 1 says that at 3:30 AM on the 20th, there was still water in the orca pool. That's interesting because if there was water, it suggests that the pool wasn't drained yet. 

Now, looking at the evidence, Evidence 3 describes the Orca Pool Diagram. It mentions that the pool is about 65 feet deep and that during cleaning, the pool water is drained. So, if the pool was being cleaned, it should be drained, right?

But Testimony 1 claims there was still water at 3:30 AM. If the pool was supposed to be drained during cleaning, then having water in the pool contradicts that. It means either the cleaning wasn't happening as scheduled or the pool wasn't drained properly.

So, putting it together: Testimony 1 says there was water at 3:30 AM, while Evidence 3 states that during cleaning, the pool is drained. These two pieces of information conflict because if the pool was being cleaned, it shouldn't have water. Therefore, they contradict each other.
</think>
